alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Southern Erie (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Lake Effect Snow Warning issued March 19 at 3:14AM EDT until March 19 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...LAKE EFFECT SNOW WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy lake effect snow occurring. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 9 inches, greatest in the higher terrain. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Southern Erie and Crawford counties. * WHEN...Until 2 PM EDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Maximum snowfall rates are expected to be 1 to 2 inches per hour through early Sunday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission strongly encourage motorists to heed all travel restrictions and delay unnecessary travel. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway, and traffic conditions.
